sourcesContent:
import React, { Component } from "react" import { connect } from "react-redux" class Result extends Component { render() { const { avatarURL, name } = this.props.author const { total_answers, selected_option_count, another_option_count, selected_option_progress, another_option_progress, selected_option, another_option } = this.props return (
Asked by {name}
Results:

Would you {selected_option.text}?

{selected_option_progress}%

{selected_option_count} out of {total_answers} votes

Would you {another_option.text}?

{another_option_progress}%

{another_option_count} out of {total_answers} votes

) } } function mapStateToProsp({ authedUser, questions, users }, props) { const { id } = props.match.params const question = questions[id] const author = users[question.author] const total_answers = Object.keys(question.optionTwo.votes).length + Object.keys(question.optionOne.votes).length const authedUser_answer = users[authedUser].answers[id] const selected_option = question[authedUser_answer] let another_option = '' if (selected_option.text === question.optionOne.text ) { another_option = question.optionTwo } else { another_option = question.optionOne } const selected_option_count = Object.keys(selected_option.votes) .length const another_option_count = Object.keys(another_option.votes) .length return { author, total_answers, authedUser_answer, selected_option_count, another_option_count, selected_option_progress: ((selected_option_count * 100) / total_answers).toFixed(1), another_option_progress: ((another_option_count * 100) / total_answers).toFixed(1), selected_option, another_option, } } export default connect(mapStateToProsp)(Result)
